bibl.title: Letter from Charles C. Lamborn to Henry Rose Carter, April 2, 1924

div1.p: Lamborn sends Carter a notice of his payment of membership dues to the Royal Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene, London.

div1.head: Letter from Charles C. Lamborn to Henry Rose Carter, April 2, 1924
div1.opener:
File
Dues-
NATIONAL SAVINGS AND TRUST COMPANY
WILLIAM D. HOOVER
PRESIDENT
WOODBURY BLAIR
VICE PRESIDENT
FRANK W. STONE
SECOND VICE PRESIDENT
FRANK STETSON
TRUST OFFICER
CAPITAL $ 1,000.000.
SURPLUS $ 1,000.000.
INCORPORATED BY SPECIAL ACT OF CONGRESS, JAN. 22TH 1847.
REORGANIZED UNDER ACT OF CONGRESS, OCT. 1ST 1850.
CHARLES C. LAMBORN
TREASURER
E. PERCIVAL WILSON
SECRETARY
FRANK R. ULLMER
ASSISTANT TREASURER
BRUCE BAIRD
ASSISTANT TRUST OFFICER
DAVID BORNET
ASSISTANT TRUST OFFICER
WASHINGTON, D.C.
April 2, 1924.
H. R. Carter, Esq.,
2121 California Street,
Washington, D.C.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
In accordance with your instructions of April 1, 1922,
we have today forwarded to the London County Westminister and
Parr's Bank, Limited, London, our draft to their order, for
11-11-6, to cover your subscription for the ensuing year to the
Royal Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene, and for which we
have charged your account with this Company $7.20.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, C C Lamborn
Treasurer.
